trans-unit.source: Represents the object element of an XML signature that holds data to be signed.
Use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject> class to store information or metadata directly in an XML signature.
For example, you can store the signature generation date or the signer's identity.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject> class may or may not be covered by the XML signature.
The class corresponds to the `<Object>` element in the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) specification for XML Signatures.
For more information about the W3C specification, see [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/](http://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject> class is used with XML signatures.

After you have initialized the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject>, you can assign the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject.Data%2A> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject.Id%2A> properties.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref> class with the specified identification, MIME type, encoding, and data.
The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject> class is used with XML signatures.
The `id` parameter refers to the name of the element that contains the data to be used.
The `data` parameter refers to the XML node list that contains the `id` parameter element.
The identification to initialize the new instance of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref> with.
The MIME type of the data used to initialize the new instance of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref>.
The encoding of the data used to initialize the new instance of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref>.
The data to initialize the new instance of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref> with.
The data parameter is `null`.
Gets or sets the data value of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref> object.
This property is the XML node list that contains the element described in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject.Id%2A> property.
The data of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref>.
The value used to set the property is `null`.
Gets or sets the encoding of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref> object.
The default value of this property is `null`, which indicates that no encoding is present.
The type of encoding of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref> object.
Returns the XML representation of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref> object.
Use this method to output XML for a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject>.
The XML representation of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the identification of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref> object.
The identification is used to reference the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject> from another location.
The default value of this property is `null`, which implies that no identification is present.
This property is commonly referenced by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Signature.SignedInfo%2A> property.
The name of the element that contains data to be used.
Loads a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref> state from an XML element.
This method can be used to add additional XML elements to a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject> object.
The XML element to load the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref> state from.
The value from the XML element is `null`.
Gets or sets the MIME type of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref> object.
The MIME type describes the data within the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject>.
The MIME type of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataObject"></xref> object.
The default is `null`.
